evidence.text: On May 9, the district court issued an order granting a temporary restraining order (“TRO”) against Defendants and compelling discovery of the ARRPs and documents related to their implementation.

extracted.value: On May 9, 2025, the district court issued an order granting a temporary restraining order (“TRO”) against Defendants and compelling discovery of the ARRPs and documents related to their implementation.

evidence.text: The district court subsequently granted Plaintiffs’ request for a preliminary injunction providing essentially the same relief.

extracted.value: On May 22, 2025, the district court subsequently granted Plaintiffs’ request for a preliminary injunction providing essentially the same relief.

evidence.text: Acting as the motions panel of our court, we deny Defendants’ emergency motion for a stay of the district court’s preliminary injunction.

extracted.value: On May 30, 2025, the appellate court denied Defendants’ emergency motion for a stay of the district court’s preliminary injunction.

evidence.text: On May 9, the district court issued an order granting a temporary restraining order (“TRO”) against Defendants and compelling discovery of the ARRPs and documents related to their implementation.

extracted.value: Granted a temporary restraining order (TRO) against Defendants and compelled discovery of the ARRPs and related documents.

evidence.text: The district court subsequently granted Plaintiffs’ request for a preliminary injunction providing essentially the same relief.

extracted.value: Granted a preliminary injunction providing essentially the same relief as the TRO.

evidence.text: Defendants filed in our court a request for an emergency stay of the district court’s preliminary injunction. Acting as the motions panel of our court, we deny Defendants’ emergency motion for a stay of the district court’s preliminary injunction.

extracted.value: Denied Defendants’ emergency motion for a stay of the district court’s preliminary injunction.

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Temporary Restraining Order and Compelling Certain Discovery Production (002)
evidence.text: the Court denied defendants’ request to convert plaintiffs’ motion for a temporary restraining order into a motion for a preliminary injunction.

extracted.value: Denied Defendants’ request to convert a temporary restraining order into a preliminary injunction.

evidence.source_document: Addendum to Emergency Motion for Stay Pending Appeal/Petition for Writ of Mandamus

extracted.value: Denied Defendants’ emergency motion for a temporary restraining order.

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Temporary Restraining Order and Compelling Certain Discovery Production (001)
evidence.text: For the foregoing reasons, this Court should stay the district court’s order enjoining the implementation of the Executive Order and the Memo.

extracted.value: Granted a stay of the district court’s order enjoining the implementation of the Executive Order and the Memorandum.

evidence.source_document: Addendum to Emergency Motion for Stay Pending Appeal/Petition for Writ of Mandamus
evidence.text:
The court should deny it.  
12 II. Plaintiffs Satisfy None of the Winter Requirements 
13 Given the timing considerations set forth above, this Court should deny the TRO motion 
14 without further consideration of the relevant requirements. But even if the Court considers the four 
15 Winter requirements, Plaintiffs satisfy none of them.

extracted.value: The court denied the plaintiffs’ TRO motion.
